newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 ends slightly up, broader index firm.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 ends slightly up, broader index firm.

text.p: Britain's leading share index ended slightly higher on Monday, while the broader market powered to a five-month peak on a favourable outlook for UK interest rates and sterling.
The FTSE 100 index of leading shares finished up 0.6 point at 5,031.9, clawing back from a one percent sell-off at the opening, to post its second highest closing level ever.
Volume was thin by 1534 GMT at 605.6 million shares, with advancing stocks leading decliners by 58 to 41.
